nodes.text: Well, the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreEvilEye],Eye]] and its MechWarriors were quick to leave the planet after we secured that facility. I wonder what else they picked out of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreInheritors],Inheritors]]'s cache since they left the stealth Assassin for us?

Well, it's a definite LosTech valuable find. Records indicate this was a prototype BattleMech made by [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMaltexCorporation],Maltex Corporation]] during the Star League for holovid productions. It even includes a prototype sword!

However, it is missing the original stealth technologies, with them being replaced with an [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreECM],ECM]] jammer. While less advanced than the original LosTech, it makes it impossible for targeting systems to work, unless it's sensor locked, but it can still be hit with physical attacks. And once it attacks, it will lose its cloaked ability.

And from what we've directly seen during combat, it's capable of sneaking and delivering a nasty hit, but it's very vulnerable when caught exposed. This is an infiltrator and hunter-killer like the Inner Sphere hasn't seen since the days of the long gone Exterminator BattleMech.

Sorry to interrupt you, but we are receiving a call with Interstellar Expeditions' authentication codes. 

It appears [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHouseKarosas],Lord Karosas]] wants to talk to us again?

branches.responseText: Put him through, we have some questions to ask him about Professor Bambo.

nodes.text: *static* Hello, hello, pick up the receiver... anyone home? Ah, here we go.

Yes, the one and only. Commander, I apologize for not being able to reach you sooner but I was not expecting that you'd follow me to Sebha and I only noticed your presence after you captured the Inheritor cache. 

I understand you'll have questions about what happened and I'll try to answer them to your satisfaction.

branches.responseText: Very well, you can start by explaining what happened at Johnson's Reef.

nodes.text:
Commander, I went to that world because for the past several months [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreInterstellarExpeditions],IE]] had received strange reports of those ghost 'Mechs.

While the intelligence services of the Successor States consider those reports as supernatural folklore, IE follows the most promising leads. On this case I was able to hit jackpot, since I was able to locate these 'ghosts' and determine that the Inheritors were operating them.

branches.responseText: For what exactly? And that entire 'ghost' lance that appeared before you took off? They were shooting at the Inheritors as well.

nodes.text: For those, your guess is as good as mine, Commander. I could tell you a number of weird theories I've heard over the years, but they're not the most important issue I found on that planet.

branches.responseText: What happened to that stealth 'Mech? How did the Inheritors get it?

nodes.text: From what I was able to determine, the Assassin was stolen from a Maltex warehouse on Errai more than two centuries ago, likely by one of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSuccessorState],Successor States]]. Afterwards there are no records of it until the present day, so I have no idea how the Inheritors got it. As for the BattleMech, after IE paid me their salvage fee they took possession of it, so I'm ignorant of its current fate.

branches.responseText: So, why have you traveled here?

nodes.text: That's due to Lord Karosas. The old fool had been collecting reports of pox outbreaks throughout the entire Periphery, until I noticed there was a correlation in the locations of the disease and the appearance of the 'ghost' BattleMechs.

As I traveled from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreErrai],Errai]] to Johnson's Reef to confirm this theory, I noticed something disturbing about the plague reports. 

The mortality rate is greater than before, but the official reports still use the older numbers. Likely [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreComStar],ComStar]] or the local governments are keeping a lid on it to prevent panic.

Panic about what?

[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePeripheryPox],Pox]] outbreaks have occurred for centuries since this region was colonized. The virus mutates periodically like the common flu, so a higher mortality rate isn't unheard of.

Fear that the situation is getting out of control. Months ago, I managed to slip inside the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreInheritors],Inheritor]] base that you just raided while I was looking for the 'ghosts'. 

What I found there horrified me enough to leave immediately for Johnson's Reef, although it was already too late for me.

Drop the suspense, will you? We're not one of your gullible readers that believe all that unsubstantiated prose you call 'science'. 

Too late for what?

Very well.

The epidemic that is ravaging this planet and has spread to the rest of the Periphery is not a natural mutation of the common pox virus but a Taurian bioweapon dating back to the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreReunificationWar],Reunification War]] named 'Death's Mask' by its creators and designed as a desperate measure to stop the invading [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSLDF],SLDF]] legions.

By the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMaximilianLiao],Chancellor]]'s beard! 

Why do I suddenly feel the need to wash both my hands, even the artificial one, after examining that stealth 'Mech?!

That's not surprising. 

The [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTaurianConcordat],Taurian Concordat]] tried nearly everything during that war to stop the invasion, from kamikaze DropShips to using their own civilians as human shields. Remember that they never signed the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAresConventions],Ares Conventions]].

And eventually, as the SLDF finally reached and invaded the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHyadesCluster],Hyades Cluster]], the Taurians came to their senses and realized it was only a matter of time before their defeat, and that releasing the bioweapon would only cause pointless and countless civilian deaths among their own population.

But as a safety measure in case it was needed in the future and to hide it from the Star League, they sent the research and existing samples of the 'Death Mask' to a secret cryogenic installation in the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDeepPeriphery],Deep Periphery]], where it remained for centuries. 

Until the Inheritors accidently stumbled upon it.

What I discovered in the base you captured was that they had recovered still intact samples of the bioweapon, already weaponized and ready to deploy against their enemies by using the stealth 'Mechs to make controlled releases that couldn't be traced back to them.

However, the Inheritors were ignorant of the mutagenic nature of the 'Death's Mask', which quickly mutated into several strains when released into the environment, as it was designed to do, making almost impossible to contain it.

When I discovered this, I went to Johnson's Reef to try to stop them but it was already too late.

But what about us? Are we in danger? 

Because I'm feeling the need to douse myself in 'Mech [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBattleMechCoolant],coolant]] fluid.

I contracted the disease somewhere on the way, and after Johnson's Reef I barely survived its effects. 

Pretty much everyone who has been in contact with the Inheritors has had a chance to be exposed to the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDeathsMask],Death's Mask]] bioweapon.
And after you raided that base, that includes you and everyone in your company, I'm sorry to say.

If this is true, we need to impose quarantine immediately, as well as a class three decontamination on the entire company and ship, Commander. 

We might limit casualties if we prepare, although it's also likely that we're too late.

branches.responseText: Do whatever is necessary, Doctor Murad.

nodes.text: Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}, it's too late for not just your company, but everyone in this system and possibly the whole Periphery. They spread the epidemic and now the local authorities are currently overwhelmed by the spread of the 'pox outbreak', with riots occurring here and on other worlds. It's only a matter of time until the situation further escalates into conflict and collapse.

branches.responseText: What about medicine? You survived, so there has to be something that works against the bioweapon like Pox antivirals.

nodes.text:
I survived through luck, not medicine.

The Inheritors knew the weapon was developed from the Periphery Pox so they stocked up on the antivirals, but they are mostly ineffective against the 'Death's Mask', as many have tried them already without much success.

With the current crisis, the antivirals' value on the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBlackMarket],black market]] has skyrocketed and the Eye saw a big opportunity because they knew it housed the Inheritors' antiviral stockpile.

At the current rates, the Eye is gonna make a fortune selling them due to the increasing panic. They saw a chance to profit and took it.

Which explains why the Inheritors guarded it so well. It was their only defense against the bioweapon they unleashed.

It's well-deserved that those idiots are also going to be hit hard by the bioweapon due to their own stupid actions, and now they have no protection against it.

Indeed, although in this case, a better retribution is at hand since I know the location of the Inheritor leader behind the 'Death's Mask' attacks and I'd like to hire your company to bring him to justice.

Even better if we use their own BattleMech against them as punishment for reviving such a terror weapon and exposing us all to it. The price for all of this will be thousands, or even millions of victims all over the Periphery and [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreInnerSphere],Inner Sphere]].

I'd prefer not to consider right now the price in victims just now. 

What do you think Commander? Should we hunt down the Inheritor leader responsible for this atrocity or stand down for quarantine and medical recovery?

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Bring to justice the Inheritor leadership.]</color> These guys aren't getting away with what they've done with that bioweapon.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Prepare the company for the plague outbreak.]</color> We can't just go doing frontier justice. We have more pressing matters to attend to.

nodes.text: I'm glad you've decided so, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. These people are about to commit genocide and they deserve to be punished for their criminal actions. I'll send you their coordinates when you're ready.

Understood Commander, I'll brief the MedTechs on what we're about to face. 

Pray that [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAlexanderKerensky],Kerensky]]'s spirit protects us.
